On Mar 19, 2008, at 3:04 AM, Sebastien Lambla wrote:

> With both POST and =
PUT what is sent in the request is an "entity"  
> and not a representation=
.
>
> Could you elaborate on that? In both put and post you have a payload =
 
> representing an entity in a certain content-type, I always  
> understo=
od this as meaning that you pass an entity representation in  
> your paylo=
ad, just like when a get is issued you get a  
> representation in the resp=
onse=92s payload.

Yes, entities have content types too, but one key differ=
ence is that  
representations are usually negotiable (through content-nego=
tiation),  
where as the data that a client is POSTing or PUTting is not. S=
ee  
2616#1.3.

>  If that=92s not hte case, are you saying that get return=
s a  
> representation but post and put submit an entity? In which case the=
  
> symmetry is broken.

Where does the symmetry requirement come from?

S=
ubbu
--Apple-Mail-3--1877325
